html: An electromagnetic wave has a frequency of [mathjaxinline]4 \times 10^{13}[/mathjaxinline] Hz. The wave travels in the [mathjaxinline]+y[/mathjaxinline] direction and the magnetic field [mathjaxinline]\vec B[/mathjaxinline] is along the [mathjaxinline]x-[/mathjaxinline]axis with an amplitude of [mathjaxinline]7.3 \times 10^{-4}[/mathjaxinline] Tesla. What are the vector equations for [mathjaxinline]\vec E[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]\vec B[/mathjaxinline]?
